title.narrative: Danish Support to ESMAP's Fighting COVID-19 with Sustainable Energy

description.narrative: The Danish Government approved the third COVID-19 emergency response package to developing countries 17 October1, 2020. In total, 13 Danish financed initiatives were endorsed by a broad political mandate and joined press release published. The package also included the present contribution to ESMAP’s COVID-19 response and amount of DKK 40.0 million. The Danish support to ESMAP’s proposal “Fighting COVID-19 and Strengthening Health Infrastructure with Sustainable Energy” will contribute to provide reliable energy to the health clinics in Sub-Saharan Africa while simultaneous demonstrate how renewable energy can replace traditional diesel generators. The Response programme aims to support at least ten low-income and fragile countries, provide 1,000 health clinics with renewable energy, improve conditions for more than 7 million patients, mobilise US$100 million IDA funding and support at least 75 energy companies to benefit from the Energy Access Relief Fund. In short, the project aims to build back better and greener by improving the health systems’ ability to fight COVID-19 and demonstrate a transition to power public institutions with green energy while at the same time support the nascent off-grid solar energy industry in Africa to get through the financial crisis.
